The Buddha observes sentient beings who are replete with wholesome dharmas, up to those who can sever wholesome roots and possess unwholesome roots.
According to Seng Liang:
Explaining the causes of regression.
There are four causes of regression:
First, not being close to good friends;
Second, even if one is close, not listening to the true Dharma;
Third, even if one listens to the Dharma, not contemplating its meaning;
Fourth, even if one contemplates the meaning, not practicing as taught.
Good man!
The TathÄgata further knows that for this person, in the present life, he will then be able to give rise to wholesome roots.
Seng Liang says:
Explaining the causes of progress.
The causes of progress are also four, briefly mentioning the two causes of associating with good friends and listening to the true Dharma.
Good sons!
It is like a spring not far from a village... is called possessing the power of the faculties of all knowledge.
Seng Liang says:
It is explained that retreating is only temporary, while giving rise to wholesomeness is definite.

The spring is likened to the Buddha-fruit, the village to the three realms, the water to permanence and bliss, thirst to the eight sufferings, the wise person to the Buddha, and the absence of different paths to the eight sufferings that can be despised and the permanence and bliss that can be delighted in, with the eight paths being definite.
At that time the World Honored One took a small amount of soil from the ground... is not comparable to the soil in the ten directions.
Seng Liang says:
It is explained that although those who retreat do so for only a short time, there are very many who retreat;
Although progress is definite, there are few who progress.
Good sons!
There are people who abandon their bodies and obtain human bodies again, up to being able to enter nirvana, like the amount of soil on the surface of the earth.
Commentary: Seng Liang said:
Progress means to go from light to light.
After abandoning the human body, one obtains the bodies of the three evil realms, up to the amount of soil in the worlds of the ten directions.
Commentary: Seng Liang said:
Retrogression means to go from light to darkness, from darkness to darkness.
Good man!
Upholding the precepts diligently and not being lazy, up to the amount of soil in the worlds of the ten directions.
Commentary: Seng Liang said:
Above it generally discusses all sentient beings, here it specifically mentions those who have left the household life and have faith in the Nirvana Sutra as different.
Good man!
The Tathagata well knows that sentient beings are like this, therefore the Buddha is said to possess the power of knowing faculties.
